resources.string: Knotty
Improved Clinch Knot
Snell Knot
Palomar Knot
Turle Knot
Uni Knot
Trilene Knot
Rapala Knot
San Diego Jam Knot
Arbour Knot
Blood Knot
Yucatan Knot
Surgeon\'s Knot
Double Uni Knot
Nail Knot
Albright Knot
Dropper Loop
Surgeon\'s Loop
Perfection Loop
Spider Hitch
Bimini Twist
Used to secure lures, hooks and swivels to the fishing line. Only pull the long end to tighten.
Used to attach a tippet or leader directly to a baited hook. Mainly for eyeless hooks.
Used to secure hooks and swivels to the fishing line. One of the strongest knots.
Used to connect a fly or hook to a leader, makes line emerge perpendicular to the hook shaft.
Used to connect the line to the hook but also connects the line to the arbour of a reel or swivel.
Used to tie lines to hooks, snaps, lures and swivels. Retains around 90 percent of the line’s original strength.
Used for tying directly to the lure. (e.g. no swivel). It retains most of the line strength.
Used to attach line to a swivel, hook, artificial fly or clip. Very popular knot.
Used to secure the line to the spool of the fishing reel. Helps anchor backing to the reel arbour for bigger fish.
Used to join two parts of fishing line with similar thickness.
Used to connect a doubled main line to a heavy leader. Strong knot for mono-filament leader to braided line.
Used to join together two piece of fishing line of varying thickness.
Used to join lines of either varying or similar strengths.
Used to connect the fly line to the leader. Good for lines with different diameters.
Used to join two fishing lines of different materials and diameters together.
Used to form a secure structure for making multiple hook bait rings.
Used to create a quick end loop in leaders and lines to connect them to other loops. It is easy and retains strength.
Used for building leaders that can be clipped into a swivel, easy knot for fly-fishing.
Used to form a double line or a loop in the line for light tackle fishing it is easy to tie and retains most of the line’s strength.
Used to make a double line leader and for loop-to-loop connections. Retains almost all strength.
Click to see how tie knot step by step
